## Comments

### Comment by @wclaytor - 2025-12-09 17:19:13

## üõ†Ô∏è New Tool Added: PNG to JPG Converter

Added `scripts/image/png2jpg.py` to help optimize screenshots for the website.

**Features:**
- Converts PNG screenshots to optimized JPG format
- Customizable quality (default: 85)
- Handles transparency (converts to white background)
- Progressive JPG for better web loading
- Shows file size savings
- **Keeps original PNG by default** for safety

**Usage:**
```bash
# Basic conversion
python3 scripts/image/png2jpg.py path/to/screenshot.png

# Custom quality
python3 scripts/image/png2jpg.py screenshot.png --quality 90

# Delete original after conversion
python3 scripts/image/png2jpg.py screenshot.png --delete-png
```

Full documentation in [`scripts/image/README.md`](https://github.com/wclaytor/wclaytor.github.io/blob/11-site-maintenance/scripts/image/README.md)

[View on GitHub](https://github.com/wclaytor/wclaytor.github.io/pull/12#issuecomment-3633380059)

### Comment by @wclaytor - 2025-12-09 18:17:54

## üé® Visual Enhancement: Unified Background with Distinct Filters

Extended the background image to all sections with unique filters to create visual distinction while maintaining cohesion.

**Changes:**
- **Projects Section**: Light, bright overlay (85% ‚Üí 75% ‚Üí 90% white) for a clean, professional look
- **Contact Section**: Dark overlay with blue tint (70% black ‚Üí 80% dark blue ‚Üí 95% black) for a cool, sophisticated feel

**Visual Flow:**
1. **Masthead** - Dark with warm black gradient
2. **About** - Dark with warm black gradient (matching)
3. **Projects** - Light and bright with white overlay (high contrast)
4. **Contact** - Dark with cool blue-tinted gradient (distinct mood)

**Result:**
Each section now has a unique character through filtered overlays while sharing the same background image, creating a unified yet visually interesting experience throughout the homepage.

### Comment by @wclaytor - 2025-12-09 19:14:03

## üìê Project Section Layout Improvements

Enhanced the Featured Project Rows with better proportions and spacing for alternating layouts.

**Changes:**
- **Featured Project Row 1** (Alpine Resume): Image left, text right with left border and padding
- **Featured Project Row 2** (Alpine Markdown Presentation): Text left with right border and padding, image right

**Technical Details:**
- Added `.featured-text-right` CSS class for reversed layouts
- Implemented mirrored padding (2rem right instead of left) for balanced spacing
- Added right border accent to match the design aesthetic
- Right-aligned text on larger screens for better visual flow

**Result:**
Both featured project rows now have comfortable, proportional spacing. The text no longer feels cramped against the image, creating a professional alternating pattern that guides the eye naturally through the projects section.
